Expresses panic verbally ('Oh god-- oh god oh god--') when gas fills the chamber, indicating momentary fear but quickly recovers.
Expresses sorrow and empathy upon learning of Abbott's death, saying 'I’m sorry. We are sorry.'
Holds her stomach, visibly affected by the news, showing emotional sensitivity.
Politely and calmly asks for information and requests a message to be sent to other sites, demonstrating respectful communication.
Maintains composure and awe while engaging with the heptapod, showing openness and tolerance toward the alien.
Controls her breathing in a tense moment, maintaining composure.
Remembers her mission and asks the heptapod to send a message to other sites, showing focus and purpose.
Directly asks the heptapod their purpose, demonstrating clear communication and confidence.
Expresses sorrow for Abbott's death, showing emotional response but not detracting from her competence.
Engages deeply with the alien logograms, showing curiosity and openness to understanding.
Experiences panic and confusion internally but continues to seek answers.
Recognizes the complexity of the timeline symbol and manipulates it to reveal its true circular nature, demonstrating insight and problem-solving skill.
Expresses confusion and panic after realizing the non-linear nature of time and experiencing a memory attack, showing vulnerability and momentary loss of control.
Emerges running toward the team despite exposure to alien atmosphere, showing determination and trust in others.
Gives Ian a pained look, showing vulnerability and openness to support.
Wobbles and allows Ian to hold her, indicating trust and reliance on others.
Emerges from behind the hill running toward the team after exposure to alien atmosphere, showing physical resilience and determination.
Appears lost and afraid, gives Ian a pained look and admits she doesn’t understand what 'Big Domino' means.
Wobbles and needs support from Ian after returning, indicating physical or emotional vulnerability.
Bends down to help her daughter remove muddy shoes, speaks gently and reassuringly to her about her father, shows love by touching her hair and holding her close.
Admits to feeling responsible for causing tension between Hannah and her father, tries to explain difficult truths with care.
Tries not to cry while comforting her daughter, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Comforts and reassures her daughter despite emotional difficulty, showing emotional intelligence and presence of mind.
Acknowledges her own fault in a difficult family situation, demonstrating self-awareness and accountability.
Struggles emotionally but maintains composure to care for her child, indicating resilience and capability under stress.
Appears distracted and reflective, possibly indicating internal conflict or hesitation.
Looks into Ian's eyes and pulls him in for a hug after recalling a painful memory.
Wipes her eyes and struggles to find her game face after revealing personal information.
Silences Ian to focus on deciphering alien language despite his objections.
Rushes to the keyboard and calls up all heptapod data on every available screen despite the pressure and limited time.
Silences Ian who doubts the feasibility of cracking the code quickly, showing confidence in her approach.
Struggles to maintain composure and wipes her eyes, showing emotional vulnerability.
Shares her discovery about the alien language and tries to explain its significance to others, showing eagerness to communicate and help.
Attempts to slow down the evacuation to convey important information, indicating concern and a desire to be understood.
Stands rigid with tension and does not immediately follow Ian's urging to leave, showing internal conflict but not overt warmth or coldness.
Declares she can read the alien language and explains its structure and significance to others.
Attempts to slow down evacuation to explain her discovery despite urgent circumstances.
Shows confidence and clarity in communicating complex ideas under pressure.
Does not resist or argue when Colonel Weber dismisses her insight and insists on evacuation.
Politely greets General Shang with a slight bow and engages in friendly conversation.
Admits to having had a bit to drink and asks for a reminder, showing humility and sincerity.
Engages politely and confidently with General Shang at a high-profile international event, showing social grace and composure.
Initially does not recall calling General Shang on his private number, indicating a momentary lapse or uncertainty.
Turns and runs for the tents instead of following Ian immediately, showing urgency and concern.
Hurries down the corridor, urgently trying to reach Shang by phone, showing determination and hope.
Turns and runs for the tents instead of following Ian into the helicopter, indicating a moment of hesitation or emotional overwhelm.
Hurries down the corridor with a sat phone to her ear, urgently trying to make contact with Shang, showing initiative and quick thinking under pressure.
Speaks urgently and directly in Mandarin to Shang from the American site, demonstrating linguistic skill and confident communication.
Speaks to Shang in Mandarin, invoking his late wife's words to persuade him to stand down and avoid war.
Locks herself in the chamber and risks confrontation with armed soldiers to prevent escalation.
Drops the phone only after ensuring the message is delivered, showing sincerity and commitment to peace.
Wipes her face tenderly and shares an intimate, sincere moment with Ian, expressing deep emotional vulnerability.
Puts her arms around Ian and kisses him, responding warmly to his affection.
Hugs her daughter Hannah goodnight and gently engages with her questions.
Maintains composure and processes complex emotional and intellectual information after receiving critical data from multiple international sources.
Shows emotional vulnerability and hesitation in sharing her full experience with Ian, indicating some internal conflict or uncertainty.
Engages in tender, meaningful communication with Ian, demonstrating emotional intelligence and interpersonal skill.
Responds to her daughter Hannah’s innocent question with gentle openness, showing patience and care.
Smiles sweetly at her daughter, explains the special meaning of her name, expresses love to Hannah.
Quietly expresses to Ian that she forgot how good it feels to be held by him.
Thanks Weber sincerely for believing in her.
Explains the concept of a palindrome to her daughter clearly and effectively, showing her ability to communicate complex ideas simply.
Acknowledges the risk taken by Weber in choosing her and accepts it with gratitude, showing confidence and awareness of her own abilities.
Refuses to try to explain what she did, indicating a possible limitation in communicating or reluctance to share complex knowledge.
Cradles newborn Hannah tenderly, showing physical affection and care.
Considers the life-changing choice of having a child with thoughtful emotion and sincerity.
Dresses beautifully and accepts Ian's compliment graciously, indicating openness and friendliness.
Teaching a university class about logograms confidently, demonstrating expertise in her field.
Reflects thoughtfully on a life-changing choice with awareness of its consequences, showing emotional intelligence and decisiveness.
Clings to her dying daughter Hannah, holding her hand in the hospital.
Hides her face in her hands, showing vulnerability and emotional pain.
Smiles warmly and says 'Yes' to Ian's question about having a baby, despite knowing the future pain.
Hides her face in her hands and sobs in hospital after Hannah's death, showing emotional vulnerability but also human response to grief.
Touches the glass with the question 'Do you want to make a baby?' and responds affirmatively despite knowing the painful future, showing emotional strength and thoughtful decision-making.
